text: Sly and the Family Stone was an American rock, funk and soul band. The band was formed in 1967 and broke up in 1983. the band played an important park in the development of soul, funk, and psychedelic music. The group was led by Sly Stone. It also included several of his siblings. They are known for their songs "Everyday People" and "Dance to the Music". In 1993, the band was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:1960s music groups Category:American rock bands Category:Funk bands Category:Musical groups from San Francisco Category:Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductees Category:Soul bands
title: Sly and the Family Stone
